author: Accesswire
title: 2024-04-18 | NYSE:HRL | Press Release | Hormel Foods Corp
text:
HRL | 1 hour ago Now in its third year, the 10 Under 20 Food Heroes program recognizes young innovators fostering positive change in our food system
AUSTIN, MN / ACCESSWIRE / April 18, 2024 / Hormel Foods Corporation, a Fortune 500 global branded food company, is now accepting nominations for the 2024 class of 10 Under 20 Food Heroes. The impact-driven program, now in its third year, recognizes the efforts of young trailblazers from across the United States whose philanthropic efforts are driving the world toward a more transparent, secure and sustainable food system.
The company is seeking candidates under 20 years of age who reside in the United States that are driven, passionate and determined to make a lasting impact on the world.
Nominations can be submitted at 10under20foodheroes.com/nominate from now through April 26, 2024.
Each 10 Under 20 Food Hero will receive support and resources from Hormel Foods and its partners, including mentorship, internship opportunities, executive networking sessions and hands-on experiences to foster their growth as future leaders. The program continues to grow into a nationwide network of young changemakers connected through purpose and passion for improving our food system.
"By celebrating and supporting the passion of young minds, we pave the way for a brighter, more sustainable future," said Katie Clark, senior vice president and chief communications officer at Hormel Foods. "The 10 Under 20 Food Heroes program is a testament to the power of youth-driven innovation in shaping tomorrow's food landscape."
To celebrate the achievements of the new cohort of Food Heroes, the 2024 award recipients and their guardians will be invited to the company's global headquarters in Austin, Minnesota, for a celebration this summer. They will also receive a financial donation to further their impactful efforts.
Explore the inspiring stories of previous Food Heroes and learn more about the program at 10under20foodheroes.com .
View additional multimedia and more ESG storytelling from Hormel Foods Corporation on 3blmedia.com.
Contact Info:
Spokesperson: Hormel Foods Corporation
Website: https://www.3blmedia.com/profiles/hormel-foods-corporation
Email: info@3blmedia.com
SOURCE: Hormel Foods Corporation
View the original press release on accesswire.com

author: @askanews_ita
title: Artigianato e Made in Italy: al via il Seminario Estivo di Symbola
text:
Mantova, 12 giu. (askanews) – L’artigianato rappresenta il cuore pulsante della manifattura italiana e, di conseguenza, del Made in Italy. Sebbene le imprese artigiane costituiscano il 21,3% del totale delle attività produttive, la loro incidenza è particolarmente significativa nel settore manifatturiero – dove raggiunge il 58,5% del totale delle imprese – e in particolare in alcuni comparti chiave come il legno, l’alimentare, l’abbigliamento, la meccanica. E’ questo il messaggio che arriva dalla campagna di comunicazione “Artigianato, futuro del made in Italy” che si conclude oggi a Mantova in occasione dalla giornata di apertura del Seminario Estivo di Fondazione Symbola. “Artigianato, futuro del made in Italy” è un’iniziativa promossa da Confartigianato, CNA, Casartigiani insieme a Fondazione Symbola e con il patrocinio del MiMit, nell’ambito della Giornata del Made in Italy, per rendere visibile l’importanza dell’artigianato italiano per la nostra economia, ma anche per la nostra qualità della vita. In Italia, oltre un milione di imprese sono artigiane, una cifra pari a circa un quarto di tutto il sistema imprenditoriale italiano.
Confrontando i quinquenni 2015-2019 e 2019-2023 si evidenzia una crescita della quota di micro e piccole imprese che hanno effettuato investimenti green, rispettivamente +23,2% e +45,9%. Queste imprese sono oltre mezzo milione (503.258): il 67% opera nei servizi, il 33% nell’industria, il 18% nell’industria manifatturiera, il 14% nelle costruzioni, solo l’1% nelle public utilities. Nel 2024 il 61,3% delle entrate di green jobs programmate in Italia sono relative a micro e piccole imprese.
Micro e piccole imprese sono il motore della cultura e della creatività italiana. Guardando ai settori culturali e creativi, queste rappresentano il 99,7% degli operatori. Un dato medio che va dai settori del software e videogames dove la quota di operatori attivi nelle micro e piccole imprese rappresenta il 98,4%.
L’artigianato non è solo una colonna portante della produzione, ma anche un motore di sviluppo economico e benessere territoriale. Le micro e piccole imprese rappresentano, in molti territori, l’unico presidio sociale ed economico. Nei piccoli comuni (meno di 5 mila abitanti) le micro e piccole imprese rappresentano il 99,4% delle imprese extra-agricole presenti nel territorio. Andando ad analizzare la distribuzione delle micro e piccole imprese per area geografica, i piccoli comuni del Nord-ovest concentrano la quota maggiore (38,7%), seguiti da Mezzogiorno (29,5%), Nord-est (19,6%) e Centro (12,2%).
Le 100 imprese coinvolte nella campagna raccontano di un artigianato italiano in trasformazione, che mantiene vive le sue radici nella tradizione, pur aprendosi con determinazione all’innovazione e alle nuove sfide del mercato globale. 100 realtà protagoniste della campagna provenienti da tutta Italia: 49 dal Nord, 20 rappresentano le regioni centrali, 31 raccontano il Sud della penisola.
“Parlando di piccole imprese e artigianato alcuni pensano ad un punto di debolezza della nostra economia. Non è così. La propensione delle imprese artigiane – sottolinea Ermete Realacci, presidente della Fondazione Symbola – a collaborare accompagna la nostra capacità di creare coesione e innovazione. L’artigianato è un’anima del Made in Italy. Questo report comunica attraverso i numeri il valore di questo sistema che alimenta la capacità di affrontare le sfide del futuro legate all’innovazione e alla sostenibilità. La foto che emerge conferma che il Paese può affrontare le sfide che abbiamo avanti chiamando a raccolta i nostri talenti senza lasciare indietro nessuno. E che come scritto nel Manifesto di Assisi non c’è nulla di sbagliato in Italia che non possa essere corretto con quanto di giusto c’è in Italia. Come ha detto Papa Francesco ‘Siamo chiamati ad essere creativi, come gli artigiani, forgiando percorsi nuovi ed originali per il bene comune'”.
[Realacci: “Motore di sviluppo economico e benessere territoriale”|PN_20250612_00022|gn00 sp35|https://askanews.it/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/20250612_101203_7A4847BA.jpg|12/06/2025 10:12:14|Artigianato e Made in Italy: al via il Seminario Estivo di Symbola|Made in Italy|Cronaca, Sostenibilita’]
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->manufacturing and engineering
Economy, Business and Finance->business strategy and marketing

author: Paw Mozter
title: Innovative Bermudagrass Genotypes Offer New Solutions for Drought-Prone Landscapes
text: In a groundbreaking study, researchers from Oklahoma State University have discovered significant variations in drought tolerance among advanced turf-type Bermudagrass genotypes. This research, pivotal in environmental management and turfgrass breeding, could lead to more sustainable landscaping practices in drought-prone regions. Understanding Drought Tolerance in Bermudagrass The study evaluated the drought response of [various Bermudagrass genotypes](https://phys.org/news/2024-07-experimental-bermudagrasses-varied-drought-response.html) under controlled conditions. Bermudagrass is a critical component of the American landscape, covering over 31 million acres as the nation's largest irrigated crop. It's extensively used in sports fields, golf courses, and lawns, particularly in the southern United States and transition zones where drought can be challenging. Researchers conducted their experiments in Stillwater, Oklahoma, a region increasingly affected by water scarcity and droughts. The findings revealed that specific experimental genotypes, such as OSU1221 and "TifTuf," exhibited superior performance under acute drought conditions. These genotypes showed remarkable resilience, maintaining turf quality and root health despite prolonged periods without water. Implications for Turf Management and Water Conservation The identification of these drought-resistant genotypes is a significant step forward for turfgrass breeders and environmental managers. With water conservation becoming a critical issue worldwide, the ability to select and cultivate drought-resistant turfgrass species is not just essential, but it also empowers you to make a significant impact on sustainable resource management. The study suggests that developing Bermudagrass with extensive root systems and higher root-to-shoot ratios could enhance drought performance. Genotypes like "TifTuf" and OSU1221 not only adapt well to prolonged drought stress but also promise to transform turf management practices. This offers new solutions for maintaining green spaces in the face of water scarcity, instilling a sense of hope and optimism in the face of a pressing global challenge. This research underscores the importance of selecting the right turfgrass species and cultivars as a primary strategy in water conservation efforts. As the global human population grows, the need for sustainable landscaping solutions becomes ever more pressing. The work done by the Oklahoma State University team provides valuable insights that could help meet these challenges head-on, ensuring that you are prepared and confident in your ability to contribute to a sustainable future. Also Read: [ 5 Reasons Why More Home Gardens Now Feature a Clover Lawn ](https://www.natureworldnews.com/articles/56950/20230616/5-reasons-why-more-home-gardens-now-feature-clover-lawn.htm) What are the Practical Applications of this Research? The practical applications of the Oklahoma State University study on [drought-resistant Bermudagrass ](https://theturfgrassgroup.com/bermuda-grass/understanding-the-benefits-and-best-practices-of-drought-tolerant-bermuda-grass/)are multifaceted and highly relevant to sustainable landscaping and water conservation. The research indicates that specific Bermudagrass genotypes, such as "TifTuf" and OSU1221, are particularly adept at thriving under water-scarce conditions. These genotypes are water-efficient, reducing the need for frequent irrigation, and durable and resilient, making them ideal for high-traffic areas like sports fields and parks. Additionally, their rapid growth and quick recovery from damage ensure a consistently attractive landscape. The environmental impact of these drought-tolerant varieties is significant, as they contribute to sustainability by helping communities manage water resources more effectively. Moreover, their versatility in landscaping means they can be used in various settings, providing a lush, green appearance with minimal maintenance. How can Homeowners Benefit from Drought-Resistant Turfgrass? [Homeowners stand to gain significantly](https://lawnlove.com/blog/best-drought-tolerant-grasses/) from incorporating drought-resistant turfgrass into their landscapes. The benefits include reduced water bills, as these grasses require less frequent watering, which translates to cost savings. They also contribute to lowered water usage, helping to conserve precious water resources, an advantage in regions experiencing water scarcity or restrictions. Drought-resistant turfgrass is known for minimal maintenance, saving homeowners time and effort in lawn care. Additionally, these grasses offer environmental benefits by mitigating heat around homes, stabilizing soil against erosion, providing safe play spaces, and reducing noise, glare, and pollution. Lastly, they maintain their aesthetic appeal during dry spells, ensuring a pleasant and inviting outdoor space. Overall, drought-resistant turfgrass is a practical and eco-friendly option for homeowners who want to maintain a beautiful lawn with minimal environmental impact. Related article: [Grass Clippings are Better Than Fertilizer for Growing Healthy Blueberries](https://www.natureworldnews.com/articles/41619/20190627/grass-clippings-are-better-than-fertilizer-for-growing-healthy-blueberries.htm) © 2024 NatureWorldNews.com All rights reserved. Left 4 Lanes temporarily closed on I-40 Westbound at Gallimore Dairy Road after crash, police say
Expect delays
Four lanes of a major Triad interstate are currently closed due to a crash, according to the Greensboro Police Department. Officers said the crash is impacting traffic on I-40 westbound at Gallimore Dairy Road. Police also said there are minor injuries, but have not shared additional details.The closure is expected to cause delays for westbound drivers. Motorists are asked to use caution and consider alternate routes, such as High Point Road or Wendover Avenue, to avoid the area.There is no information on what led to the crash or when roads are expected to reopen.This is a developing story; check back for updates.
GREENSBORO, N.C. —
Four lanes of a major Triad interstate are currently closed due to a crash, according to the Greensboro Police Department.
Officers said the crash is impacting traffic on I-40 westbound at Gallimore Dairy Road. Police also said there are minor injuries, but have not shared additional details.
Advertisement
The closure is expected to cause delays for westbound drivers. Motorists are asked to use caution and consider alternate routes, such as High Point Road or Wendover Avenue, to avoid the area.
There is no information on what led to the crash or when roads are expected to reopen.
This is a developing story; check back for updates.

author: Shalomp (invalid@example.com)
title: super duper chio japanese babe know how to cook and is every sinkies dream girl!
text:
Japanese TikToker lives & cooks in bug-infested apartment, evicted after not paying rent for 21 months
Hoarding is one thing.
But a Japanese woman, who goes by the handle @shirokumatyandaisuki1999 on TikTok, took that concept to a different level through her cooking videos on the social media app.
While showcasing how she makes her meals, viewers are also shown how incredibly, incredibly dirty her apartment is.
She was seen cooking her meal with an electric pot and recklessly placing it on top of a pile of her belongings.
What was shocking though were the many insects crawling on the wall behind. In fact, this writer let out a loud squeal when he saw how many bugs there were.
Can someone enlighten us on how she not only cooks but lives in that unsanitary place?
The video has since been viewed more than 16mil times.
However, it seems there is at least one clean item in her possession – a teddy bear plushie wrapped in plastic.
According to the woman, it is kept as such as she didn’t want the insects to eat at it.
Maybe cleaning your living space will solve that problem?
She also took to X, formerly known as Twitter, that she was behind her rent for a year and nine months before the landlord evicted her from the apartment.
The woman even posted a picture of a masked officer arriving to remove her from the building.
We think the landlord is a saint for allowing her to continue living in such squalor for as long as she did.
Since her eviction, the woman has also taken to videoing herself brushing her teeth — for the first time in three days, she wrote — along the streets.
She is now staying at a hotel though we wonder how long that will last.
Netizens took to the comments with disgust, with many writing about how grossed out they were.
While some asked how she could live so unhygienically, others asked if the woman adds the bugs on the wall to her cooking.
One netizen even suggested she collaborate or bunk in with Indonesian vlogger, Haritsu, who is infamous for cooking and eating rotting food.
Seriously?
https://www.todayonline.com/8days/j...icted-after-not-paying-rent-21-months-2480471
